meanings.definition: A person who wastes time or resources.
meanings.sent1: She is always late and never finishes her work on time, making her one of the biggest wasters in the office.
meanings.sent2: The wasters in the group spent the whole day chatting instead of working on the project.
meanings.sent3: The wasters at the party were the last ones to leave, enjoying every minute without a care.
meanings.sent4: He was a waster of opportunities, letting every chance slip through his fingers.
meanings.sent5: The wasters in the marathon lagged behind, stopping to take selfies along the way.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'waster', referring to someone who is wasteful.
meanings.sent1: The wasters in the neighborhood always leave their lights on, wasting electricity.
meanings.sent2: She scolded her children for being wasters and not turning off the water while brushing their teeth.
meanings.sent3: The wasters in the family finished all the snacks in one sitting, leaving nothing for later.
meanings.sent4: He was known as one of the biggest wasters in the company, constantly overspending on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent5: The wasters in the class never recycled their paper, contributing to the growing pile of waste.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'waster', referring to items that are wasted or thrown away.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen bin was full of food wasters, leftovers from last night's dinner.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist group organized a cleanup to collect plastic wasters from the beach.
meanings.sent3: The garden was full of plant wasters, dried-up flowers that had wilted in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The garage was cluttered with electronic wasters, old gadgets that were no longer in use.
meanings.sent5: The dumpster behind the supermarket was overflowing with cardboard wasters, boxes that had been discarded.
